DIY Dental Hygiene: With no dentists available, individuals could take matters into their own hands by creating their own dental hygiene products. This could include homemade toothpaste, mouthwash, and floss. People could use ingredients like baking soda, hydrogen peroxide, and essential oils to create their own toothpaste. A confidence score of 0.8.

Community Dental Co-ops: In the absence of dentists, communities could come together to create dental co-ops. These co-ops would provide a shared space for people to receive dental care from trained volunteers. Volunteers could learn basic dental techniques and provide care on a rotating schedule. A confidence score of 0.9.

Mobile Dental Clinics: Mobile dental clinics could be set up in areas where dental care is scarce. These clinics would be equipped with portable dental equipment and staffed by trained dental professionals. They could travel to different locations to provide dental care to people in need. A confidence score of 0.9.

Online Dental Consultations: With the rise of telemedicine, online dental consultations could become a viable option for people without access to dentists. Patients could connect with dental professionals through video conferencing and receive virtual dental consultations. A confidence score of 0.8.

Dental Apprenticeships: In the absence of dentists, individuals could learn dental techniques by apprenticing with experienced dental professionals. This would allow people to gain hands-on experience and learn from the best. A confidence score of 0.9.
